name: 4-{(2E)-3-[4-(dimethylamino)phenyl]prop-2-enoyl}phenyl 2-methoxybenzoate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1123
Reason: 4-{(2E)-3-[4-(dimethylamino)phenyl]prop-2-enoyl}phenyl 2-methoxybenzoate is a complex molecule with multiple functional groups. To predict the melting point, we can compare it to the melting points of simpler molecules with similar functional groups. The benzoate group has a melting point of around 40°C, and the dimethylamino group contributes approximately +10°C. The conjugated double bond system in the prop-2-enoic acid group increases the rigidity of the molecule, which can raise the melting point by about +20°C. The phenyl group contributes approximately +20°C, and the methoxy group adds around +5°C. The overall melting point is expected to be higher than the sum of the individual contributions due to the synergistic effects of the functional groups.
